Name: Judge Dredd: Klegg-Hai!
Description:
Klegg-Hai!, Klegg-Hai!, Klegg-hai! This chilling alien battle cry has echoed across a universe of battlefields, heralding the arrival of the nightmarish Klegg. Mercenary warriors over ten feet tall and resembling an enormous bipedal Crocodile. The Klegg are utterly ruthless in the art of war; surrender is futile as prisoners are not taken – they are eaten!

The Klegg first roamed the streets of the ‘Big Meg’ during the corrupt reign of Judge Cal. So feared were these vicious extra-terrestrial carnivores that Dredd’s victorious Judges attempted to exterminate every last Klegg in the city.

Despite this, the Klegg are born survivors and small groups can still be found deep in the ruins and slum blocks, ready to fight just for the pleasure of killing or selling their skills to any underworld maniac prepared to pay them in fresh meat!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Judge Dredd Miniature Game (Warlord Games)

Name: Black Stories Junior: Funny Stories
Description:
Why did Oskar climb into a garbage can freshly showered? Why did Mrs. Öhmchen serve her burglar coffee and cake? Why was Tiago mistaken for a turkey? And how could the toilet flush expose a thief?

These funny and absurd riddles about disgusting ice creams, burning underpants, clumsy criminals or exploding dog poop are all a bit curious - and sometimes sheer unbelievable. The squeaky-clean puzzle stories are full of wit and can only be solved by clever thinking around corners and good deduction skills. Disbelief and spontaneous smiles included!

The black stories Junior are exciting puzzle stories on cards, which must be cracked together. Only the game leader knows the solution to the riddle because he reads the riddle on the front aloud and may also study the solution on the back carefully. The other players now try to find the solution step by step by asking questions and guessing.

Name: Combo Cone Paradise
Description:
Welcome to Combo Cone Paradise, where our combos are even sweeter than our ice cream. Congratulations on your first day, rookie! You and up to 4 other newly hired Combo Artisans will be fronting this branch, serving up sweet combolicious ice cream to our customers. Of course, each of you will be evaluated, and the Artisan who brings in the most coin by the end of the day shall be promoted to Head Combo Artisan of this branch!
Now show me what you’ve got, Artisans!

Combo Cone Paradise is a 2 to 5 players game that pits players against each other to build up combos, and serve as many customers as possible. Player takes one of three actions during their turn.


     Drafting different flavors of ice creams into their hand
     Draw a wild flavored ice cream and reserve a customer order
     Place ice-cream on the available cones and serving them to customers


When placing ice-creams on the cone, you will be able to place more ice-creams than you are entitled to, by combining the right brand of ice cream together.

The player who earns the most points based on the types of ice-cream served to customers, wins!

Name: The Witcher: Old World – Ciri
Description:
Cirilla Fiona Elen Riannon, sole princess of Cintra — daughter of Pavetta and Duny, granddaughter of Queen Calanthe. By the Law of Surprise, her fate was bound with the White Wolf Geralt of Rivia, leading her to undergo witcher training at the School of the Wolf at Kaer Morhen. Among her many titles and aliases, one stands out in particular: The Lady of Space and Time. Thanks to the Elder Blood running through her veins, Ciri holds the ability to travel between realms, across different periods of time. This got us thinking that perhaps Ciri could have traveled all the way back to the Old World, joining other witchers in the hunt!

A miniature and a full set of character components. We imagined that it was possible for her to travel to the Old World and have an adventure there. That expansion adds variety to your character choice in the game and we are certain that people will argue each time, who gets to be Ciri.

Ciri is a crowdfunding exclusive expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: 7 Wonders: Leaders – Cédrick & Thomas Promo Card
Description:
At the end of the Age when this card enters play, before the Resolution of Military Conflicts phase, choose one of the two following effects:

     Either the Military Conflict phase doesn’t happen at all and no players take any Military Victory or Defeat tokens.
     Or all players complete the Military Conflict phase twice.

Name: Rush Out! Goodies: The Familiars
Description:
Both the sorcerer and the heroes now have creatures to help them in their adventures.

Use your familiar to help you complete cards faster.

Included with the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter as part of the Bone pack.

Name: Zot van Vlaanderen
Description:
Which Belgian Beer is also a duck sound? Is there chicken meat in Kipkap? Experience Zot van Vlaanderen at home. Laugh, sing and reminisce with the Zot van Vlaanderen Companionship Game. Players compete against each other and must reach the Flemish cobblestones by guessing songs, answering questions and collecting chips. Knowledge of Flanders, tactical insight and, not to forget, building bridges, are the keywords for this fun game.

Like Trivial Pursuit, players roll dice and answer trivia questions matching the icon on the space they landed. Players must move through three tiers of questions to land on the cobblestones in the middle of the board and win the game.


Welk Belgisch Bier is ook een eendengeluid? Zit er kippenvlees in Kipkap? Beleef 'Zot van Vlaanderen' bij je thuis. Lach, zing en haal leuke herinneringen op met het 'Zot van Vlaanderen' Gezelschapsspel. Spelers strijden tegen elkaar en moeten doormiddel van het raden van liedjes, beantwoorden van vragen en verzamelen van fiches de Vlaamse kasseien zien te bereiken. Kennis van Vlaanderen, tactisch inzicht en, niet te vergeten, bruggenbouwen, zijn de steekwoorden voor dit plezante spel.

Name: Kopflos
Description:
Laying cards with head and body cards: The 24 cards showing headless bodies of various shapes are matched by 12 head cards with 2 heads each. 4 head cards (= 8 heads) are laid out. The two players try to complete figures from their 2 hand cards each. Whoever can put on the 2nd matching body receives the 3 cards. The winner is the player who has collected the most cards.

—user summary

Name: Die Katze im Sack
Description:
Puzzle game in which cards are drawn from a bag: The task is to puzzle together cat motifs on grid-structured picture tableaus. The game contains 4 picture boards with 3x4 fields and pre-drawn cat motifs as well as 4x12 square cardboard cards for the 4 cat motifs.
The winner is the first to complete his picture.

—user summary

Name: 7 Wonders: Cities – Shadow Guild Promo Card
Description: At the end of the game, gain 1 victory points for each Black  card  in  your  neighbors’ Cities.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Da Vinci's Telescope
Description:
While studying Leonardo Da Vinci’s many paintings, drawings, sketches and notes, collector Sam Anoli came across a gem; a totally unknown telescope! Judging by all the well-hidden clues in Da Vinci’s works, this special telescope must contain a great important secret that can only be discovered while watching the solar eclipse…

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Tomb Robbers
Description:
An ancient map leads you directly to the legendary tomb of Osiris. After weeks of digging you finally unearth the enormus entrance gate to the pyramid. As you step inside the huge cylindrical entrance room, you suddenly hear a disturbing scraping noise. From a hole in the ceiling, sand behins to flow into the room at an alarming rate. You estimate you'll only have one hour to find the treasures inside the tomb of Osiris and get out before this ‘giant hourglass’ will forever block your way to freedom.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: HerbaLexikon
Description: HerbaLexikon is a deck of illustrated flash cards with the properties and effects of 40 herbs. It includes the rules for 8 games - 3 for young children who have not yet learned to read, and 5 for older children who can.  It's aim is to teach the knowledge of herbs that once came from grandmothers to today's children.

Name: Alpujarras: Farmer's Feud Pack
Description:
This promotional pack is a mini-expansion to Alpujarras (provided to Kickstarter backers, but separately available directly through Dr Finn's Games). It includes 5 game cards and 1 rules card.  Each game card shows one of the five farming regions and is paired to a goal card. When completing a goal, if you have more farmers than your opponents in the paired region, you earn additional dirhems.

The pack intensifies the area-control aspect of Alpujarras, which is part of the base game, but not a central aspect.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fisheries of Gloucester: Fisherman's Feud Pack
Description:
This promotional pack was provided to Kickstarter backers of Fisheries of Gloucester, though it is separately available directly from Dr Finn's Games.

The pack has 6 double-sided game cards and 2 rule cards.  At the game start, each player drafts 3 cards and places them "star-side" face up.  Each round a player may use one card's special ability.  If it's on its star side (with more powerful ability), the player turns it to the other side and then gives it to the other player, who may use the card on a later day. If the card is already on its non-star side, it is discarded after use.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Little Flower Shop Dice Game: Daily Goal Pack
Description:
This promotion pack was provided to Kickstarter backers and is separately available directly through Dr Finn's Games. The pack has 7 daily goal cards and 1 rules card. At the start of each day, a daily goal card is flipped. The first player to complete the goal scores a bonus point.

—description from the publisher

Name: Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit Bonus Pack #2
Description: This expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit (ASLSK) system adds two maps and eight scenarios. Included scenarios examine battles between all the major WWII combatants and cover little-known areas such as Tengxian, Oslo and Manila as well as well-known battles around Smolensk and Nijmegen. Because of the breadth of pieces needed, ownership of ASLSK kits #1,#2, #3, #4 and Expansion Packs #1 and #2 are required.
Families: Game: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit

Name: 5150: Gaea Prime First Defense
Description:
We Take the War to the Enemy.

Gaea Prime considers her proper place to be in the center of the First Ring, the center of the 5150 universe.

But that is now.

In the beginning there was only Gaea Prime, floating in space in a dream of isolation, waiting to be awakened.

Then the Hishen Came.

Attacked by a Race of Slave Traders with superior technology and weapons Gaea Prime must fight for it's survival.

Inside you'll find:

     A man to man combat system that plays quickly with realistic results.
     Rules for tabletop play with minis you may already have or on a Battle Board with terrain and color counters we've provided.
     Complete rules designed for solo, cooperative and head to head play .
     Complete Campaign rules that link your games into a viable Story - your Story.


The Hishen has landed and it's time for...
GAEA PRIME - FIRST DEFENSE

Can You Answer Her Call?

—description from the publisher

Name: 5150: Star Army – Citizen Soldier
Description:
Rules for Infantry, Vehicles and Mechs for Tabletop play.
5150 Star Army - Citizen Soldier
Played with minis and terrain on the tabletop.

In 5150: Star Army – Citizen Soldier you start as a Private and have ten years to rise in the Ranks and become a Gaea Prime Citizen with all the benefits.

Inside you’ll find:

     A man to man combat system that plays quickly yet yields realistic, some say unforgiving, results.
     Rules for Mechs and Vehicles.
     Over a dozen different units you can join not to mention the three Alien Races you’ll meet. Can you say Bugs? You know what we’re talking about.
     An easy to use bookkeeping system that tracks your successes and failures as you move up or down the Ranks.
     Multiple Missions that allow for a quick and easy Campaign where the results of one Mission affects the next.
     A game system designed for solo and co-op play – designed for; not a lame “can be played solo” game.
     Play with any figures you already have or the color counters we’ve included - Infantry, Mechs, Vehicles and Bugs,.
     All this and much more…


So do you want to be a Citizen?

Welcome to the world of...
5150: Star Army - Citizen Soldier!

—description from the publisher

Name: 5150: Star Army – Cestus V
Description:
5150: Star Army – Cestus V is a Campaign book that includes the basic Star Army rules.

Cestus V is a small planet in the 4th Ring claimed by Gaea Prime but not in Gaea Prime space. It’s seen its share of hard times as it’s always been a lawless place and then got invaded by Bugs. Well the Bugs finally got pushed out, it got “re-populated” and things began to settle down.

Except now the Hishen have landed and that’s not good. Having the threat of the Hishen Empire on the fringe of Gaea Prime space is unacceptable.

So now you’ve been sent back to Cestus V to kick them out.

Cestus V is totally compatible with 5150 Star Army Citizen Soldier but is a stand alone game as well. 
Can be played with any figures you already have and includes color counters as well.

Gaea Prime Star Army,
We take the war to the enemy; one Planet at a time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moku Tower
Description:
Moku Tower’s gaming concept originates from our previous product – Woodas. The theme of Moku Tower is to integrate wood art into tabletop game. It is an unconventional idea that transforms wood art into an artistic, interactive and strategic tabletop game that can be played with a group of friends and/or family members. Moku Tower combines the concept of "timing", "stacking" and "strategy" into one single game. It allows you to casually mess round, laugh and interact closely with your cool friends.

Moku Tower is not only a great party game, it is also an amazing home decoration that can impress your friends. When you are not playing, you can simply display Moku Tower as an art piece. Each game contains 10 different pieces of wooden rocks (includes both big and small) and are made of 8 different types of natural wood material (ash, pine, sapele, maple, walnut, birch, camphor and rosewood). Each of them has different grain, color, weight, texture and even aroma. Also, each piece of wood is exquisitely handcrafted by our wood master. Hence, each of them has its own unique cutting and angle, making Moku Tower one of your most exquisite and unique home decoration.

In respect of the gameplay, in order to win in Moku Tower, you need to be good at timing, stacking and strategy. Within the time limit from the hourglass, players need to stack the wooden rocks to gain points based on the requirements that they draw from the cards. Throughout the stacking process, your opponents can attack you using their "Function cards". Make good use of the Function cards! It can be the turning point for the whole story. The player who first reaches the accumulative target point wins the game.

Name: Kung Fu Panda Stack Poetry: Duel Edition
Description:
The Kung Fu Panda Stack Poetry - Duel Edition integrates 112 poems and their corresponding titles, dynasties and authors into the game. Let the children explore ways to recite poems in the game and improve their memory of the poems during play the game. In the game, the children can only win the game if they can recite these poems successfully. 
We hope that children can be happy, learn knowledge, and improve the necessary abilities during the gameplay. 
We provide teaching video for this game, hoping to help children enjoy the game as soon as they start to play it.
Win the cool stacking poetry game with your memory and speed!

Game preparation:

     Shuffle the poem cards
     Both players will get 1 set of pagodas (each set contains 5 pagodas of red, yellow, blue , green and white)
     Place the bell on the center of the table


Start the game:

     Flip a card with the colored text face up. Both players need to arrange the text on the card in the order they appear in the poem, and arrange in the correct order of 5 pagodas from the bottom to the top. Two characters with same color use a same pagoda.
     The first player finishes stacking the pagoda rings the bell on the table.
     The player rings the bell checks the result. If it's correct, the player can put the poem card in front of him/her; If it's incorrect, remove the poem card from the pile. Of course, if you want to enhance your impression and understanding of this poem, you might as well read the content on the poem card before remove it out from the pile.


(Please note: To be fair, when flipping the poem card, you should hold the card away from your side to flip the card, to ensure that this player is the last one to see the content of the card)

The end of the game:

     The game ends immediately when there is a player gets 8 poem cards
     This player wins


—description from the publisher

Name: Meadow: Bigfoot Promo Card
Description:
Expand your Meadow collection with Bigfoot promo card!

Shuffle Bigfoot into N deck, try to create a perfect environment for him and add this mythical creature to your meadow to make it even richer.

Name: Demeter: Autumn & Winter
Description:
Autumn & Winter is an expansion for Demeter, a game that features the same graphic style and is set in the same universe as the publisher's earlier game Ganymede.

It contents 2 new score pads (Autumn and Winter) with new mechanics, new objectives, solo and multi challenges and bonuses for Varuna.

—description from the publisher

Name: Journey's Edge
Description:
It was a bad wreck, yet somehow, you survived. You don't remember what happened, or how, but something went terribly wrong aboard that cursed vessel. Now you must begin the incredible journey that lies ahead, mustering every ounce of strength and willpower you have left, with one goal in mind ... staying alive.

Players travel a modular tile map to reveal uncharted areas, acquire resources, and build necessary items needed to outlast nature's harshest elements. Over the course of eight rounds, an event-driven scenario containing mission-critical objectives force players to wisely manage their precious inventories and prized possessions. These objectives must be completed by the end of the eighth round in order for players to be victorious.

Journey's Edge features strictly strategic gameplay, with hardly any luck (or dice). At each player's disposal is a deck of action cards that are used to move their character across the board to gather food, wood, stone, and fur, which can then be spent to create items like clothing and shelter. They must manage these limited resources carefully and work together as a team to determine the best course of action. To succeed, no one can be left behind.

Discover enchanted locations. Gather valuable resources. Craft useful tools and weapons. Encounter deadly creatures and monsters, and uncover magical artifacts that will assist you in your quest at Journey's Edge. Odds are against you, but perhaps your fate is not sealed. As part of a team of seasoned expeditionists, you know what must be done. The question is, will it be enough to ensure your survival?

—description from the designer

Name: Tiles of the Arabian Nights
Description:
The company entered bankruptcy during this project and comments in the crowdfunding campaign indicate that crowdfunded versions were never delivered.  It appears a shipment of games was offered in retail in France/Gernamny starting in 2023.  No notes if the 2023 version actually included any Kickstarted expansions. 
 

Tiles of the Arabian Nights is set in the universe of the Arabian Nights. In Bagdad, storytelling has become deeply ingrained in the city’s culture ever since the legendary Scheherazade told 1001 unforgettable tales over as many nights. In honor of the queen, the Sultan now holds a storytelling contest each year!This year, as a citizen of Bagdad, you’re taking part in the contest, in the hopes of winning the title of Master Storyteller. But coming up with a good story isn’t easy, and as every tale contains at least a grain of truth, you find yourself in search of a little inspiration…

So get ready to head out into the desert in search of adventure! As you explore, you’ll meet colorful characters, find amazing treasures, and defeat fearsome foes. Each new discovery you make will earn you an Adventure tile. Once you’ve collected enough tiles for your story, you’ll return to Bagdad to tell it to the awaiting crowds.

Exactly what your story will be is up to you…

Use the beautiful, unique illustrations on your tiles as inspiration to come up with a story worthy of the Arabian Nights! Each tale you tell will earn you points from the Sultan himself, and from other players. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade –  Rivals: The Wolf & The Rat
Description:
The Wolf & The Rat is an expansion for Vampire: The Masquerade  Rivals that adds two new clans:  GANGREL & NOSFERATU. Connected through animalism, but divided by opposing loyalties, the Gangrel and Nosferatu provide ample opportunity to unleash the beast within and explore the more feral side of their clan’s animal nature. You may play these two clans head-to-head with the pre-constructed decks provided, or integrate them with your Core Set and other expansions to create unique strategies for conquering your foes!

Features:

     Adds two new clans: GANGREL & NOSFERATU
     Play these two clans head-to-head or integrate them with your Core Set.
     Includes a 30 card Crypt Pack to customize your decks!
     Designed for 2-4 players, ages 14+ to play in 30-70 min per game.


—description from the publisher

Name: Lunar
Description:
Earth’s first colonies have arrived and are fighting each other for precious resources and ultimately, survival. You’re thousands of miles away from Earth with orders to protect the most vital assets of your homeland’s colony. Will you take hold on the moon or drift off into the void?

Lunar is a brutal 32mm skirmish game set during humanity’s battle for lunar superiority. Choose from a variety of factions including the USA, USSR, Republic of China and more.

Each box includes everything you and friend need to play, including a range of multipart resin astronauts that will allow you to create two opposing forces equipped with a variety of weapons and items.

A game of Lunar is played with 3-5 miniatures per side on a 2’×2′ area. Gameplay is based on a simple D6 mechanic that makes the game easy to understand and easy to teach new players.

—description from the designer

Name: Mixed Doubles
Description:
A risk-taking dice game of colorful combinations.

GO ALL IN | STEAL CARDS | CREATE NEW COLORS | WIN THE JACKPOT

Players take turns making wagers, rolling the dice, and mixing colors in order to earn points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

How to win points:
On their turn, a player draws three cards and places them face up in their palette (i.e., pile). The player has the option to wager one or more cards (of one color) to the jackpot. The player then rolls the dice. If they successfully "mix" colors (e.g., by rolling a yellow + blue to create green), the player wins all green cards in their palette and the jackpot. If the player wagered green cards on their turn, they also win the green cards in the other players' palettes.

—description from the publisher

Name: 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine – Set #2
Description:
An additional set of cases for 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine. This package comprises cases #21-40:

21. The speeding bullet (1959)
22. The forty whacks (1892)
23. The final flight (1937)
24. Even blondes get the blues (1962)
25. Death of a dream (1968)
26. The twisted cord (1977)
27. The bushy-haired man (1954)
28. The Candy Man's Wife (1977)
29. The flamingo's curse (1947)
30. The blood-stained laundryman (1929)
31. The empty bench (1930)
32. The body on the beach (1931)
33. The sea-tac slayings (1980's)
34. The vicar's last sermon (1924)
35. The right field shot (1988)
36. The nebulous nuggets (1949)
37. The jolly girls' lament (1967)
38. The president's man (1993)
39. The buried hatchet (1918)
40. The walking corpse (1935)

Name: Disparity Trap
Description:
Disparity Trap: The Socially Conscious Board Game is a game where player can learn how race as a system impacts those of us who live within the United States. Disparity Trap can bring conversations about race to effective levels whether played at home with friends and family, in professional settings, or in junior high through college-level classrooms.

The game play is like many of its kind, where your individual goal is to accrue as much wealth as possible. But where it differs is that you can play competitvely or cooperatively where you work with your fellow players to dismantle the Disparity Traps seeking to keep everyone in poverty. Within this game you also step into someone else’s shoes; to experience the disparities within an identity different from your own. Throughout the game, the dice roll correlates your identity in the game to real life statistics. So like life, the dice are in your “hands,” but the odds are not.

In the competitive version, the first play around the board wins.  In the cooperative version, all players must make it to Tier 3 and obtain 3 or more wealth tiles.  If, however, any 2 players are separated by more than 1 tier, the game is lost.

A print-n-play workbook is available for educators and cards have QR codes for more learning opportunities.  A simplified version of the rules was released in 2024.

—description from the designer

Name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 03
Description:
BLASTER: Vol. 3 includes an exclusive standalone game, Sludge War, and four expansions:


     Sludge War (Standalone Game) - Sludge is a complete and incredibly rich standalone game. Massive armies are on the march in an unceasing conflict that shadows over humanity, and even the environment, grinding it all down into a pulp. It is 52 pages of inglorious black powder plus gaming at its finest.



     Shadowgrave Part II - Official Expansion for Rangers of Shadow Deep, Frostgrave, and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.  The worlds of Rangers of Shadow Deep and Frostgrave are being invaded from unfathomable horrors that their heroes can barely stand up against. Will you wield magic to defend against the darkest threat your world has seen? And at what cost are you willing to do so? 



     Gaslands: Legacy - Official Campaign Expansion for Gaslands: Refuelled. Earth gets an eviction notice from Mars, and becomes dismantled and reassembled into a progressively more chaotic post-post-apocalyptic world. Randomly generate an illegal build and get out of the factory fast before you become dismantled yourself. Unique LEGACY Gaslands rules, and five awesome narrative scenarios. Find out more here.



     Gamma Wolves: Ronin - Official Expansion for Gamma Wolves - Mecha pilots vie for dwindling resources on a post-apocalyptic earth. What path will your mercenary pilot take? Will she follow The Path of the Guardian and fight to protect her team? Will she follow the Path of the Sword and down enemy mechs in honorable combat? Or will she prefer to stalk her prey with the Path of the Hunter?



     The Mysterious Anomalies of Site-X - Official Expansion for This is Not a Test. Truly unpredictable anomalies plague Site-X, a supplement for This is Not a Test. Will your quest for some of the rarest and powerful artifacts aid your survival or send your models flying across the board into a wall, or even being shred up into indiscernible viscera?


This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for the miniatures games noted above.

—user summary

Name: Traders of Cardonia
Description:
Traders of Cardonia is a medieval trading-themed package with its own unique setting. It contains a set of 3 different games.

Trading Cards: A worker placement game where the cards you play as workers with special abilities are played to a grid with unique worker placement markets on the backs. Because you choose which workers and markets to use within each game, the strategies in each game will change. And because the workers in your opponents' hands are also markets that are not available to you, the game is ever-changing from beginning to end.

Tricks of the Trade: A trick-taking card game based on the Dyad system (Dyad) in which the resources are scarce, and you must obligate other players to buy your trade goods to sell them. Assemble a team of workers that allow you to access unique special abilities.

Medley: A unique blended game experience that combines the worker placement in Trading Cards with the trick-taking aspects of Tricks of the Trade. As you play a worker placement phase, you will also draft from the available cards which can be played to tricks in the trick-taking phase.

Trading Cards and Medley also feature AI opponents for a solitaire game.

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Dark Seamstress
Description:
Promo settlement event and unique gear cards included with the Pinups Of Death II that is not part of the base game.

Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 1 settlement event, 4 unique gear cards, art cards for each pinup, and 11 highly detailed hard plastic models. 
A pinup collection containing all 11 Pinups from the first Kingdom Death: Monster Kickstarter.

Each box makes 11 miniatures and contains:

     Optional Kingdom Death Monster Settlement Event Dark Seamstress. A special event that can occur in your settlement.
     4 pieces of optional gear to be used in Kingdom Death Monster: Lantern Brassiere, Leather Bodysuit, Rawhide Corset, and Teeth Bikini.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Alt Art Monster Traits (Butcher and King's  Man)
Description:
Promo alternative monster trait cards with the Pinups Of Death III that is not part of the base game.

A new pinup collection containing 13 miniatures originally offered in the Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Kickstarter campaign. Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 3 alternative monster trait cards, 6 unique universal cards, art cards for each pinup, and 13 highly detailed hard plastic miniatures.

Each box makes 13 miniatures and contains:

     3 Monster trait cards with new artwork. These can be used as a fun and illustrative replacement for the trait cards in a monster's respective AI deck. This includes Battle Tempo and Familiar Face for the King's Man and Berserker for the Butcher.
     6 Unique universal cards graced by the art of pinups from this set.

Name: Replicants!: United Sol Colonies
Description:
The Replicants are starting to adjust to a solar system devoid of organic life. It was chaos at first, but, for the most part, the mega hives a have started to create some stability. The United Sol Colonies, or U.S.C. for short (who this expansion is focused on), are doing their part to bring structure (or structures =P) to the system. They are currently building a network of space stations that all Replicants may have access to, provided they follow a few simple rules:


     No fighting on the space stations.
     Use the rooms you need to and move on, so others may use them too.
     Help build additions to the stations you visit.
     Everyone must spend their own resources to activate functions they wish to use.
     Stay out of other hives’ lockers.


In the U.S.C. Expansion you will pick your favorite hive and join the effort to make the system a better place for all Replicants.

Game play, for the most part, is similar to the core game (which is required to play the expansion.)

Like in the core game, you will deal out a resource grid each round, and place your drones to collect resources. But between those two phases, you now have a Station phase. During the Station phase, you will get to move your two personnel around the station to access the functions of the different rooms. Room functions consist of things like: build new rooms, resource discounts when leveling up new replicants, buying points, and more.

After the Drone phase, you still spend the resources you produced or gained to level up your Replicants. However, instead of discarding any unused resources from your hand at the end of the round, you now send them off to your locker on the space station. Once resources are in your locker, you may not use them for leveling up your replicants, but they can be used for activating any functions on the station.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Alternative Monster Trait (Dung Beetle Knight and Manhunter)
Description:
Promo alternative monster trait cards that were included with the Pinups Of Death V that was not part of the based game.

A new pinup collection containing 11 miniatures originally offered in the Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Kickstarter campaign. Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 3 alternative monster trait cards, a double-sided poster, art cards for each pinup, and 11 highly detailed hard plastic miniatures.

Each box makes 11 miniatures and contains:
3 Monster trait cards with new artwork.  These can be used as a fun and illustrative replacement for the trait cards in a monster's respective AI deck. This includes Baller and Separation Anxiety for the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion and Tombstone for the Manhunter Expansion.

Name: Runes of Zun: Arcane Secrets
Description:
The Arcane Secrets Expansion will transform how you play Runes of Zun. This expansion is all about advanced knowledge, fortune, and card manipulation.

There are six new action types (good and bad), a new reaction type, and a new and unique modifier type. Mix them into your original game for a total of 78 cards. If you also mix in the original Action Packed Expansion and the Shadow Tactics Expansion, you'll get a total of 114 cards in your deck (or 123 with all the promos!)

New tactics will emerge, and game-changing combos will win out. Are you ready?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Game of Life: A Day at the Dog Park
Description:
Hit the dog park and share the adventures and surprises of dogs at play! The Game of Life: A Day at the Dog Park pet edition board game is a dog lover's version of classic The Game of Life gameplay. In this game it's all about the treats that are used to buy Dog Bones. Players can get them by landing on a Dog Bone or Steal a Dog Bone space, pulling an Action card, winning Spin to Win, or paying the baker.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNO Showdown
Description:
UNO Showdown is the matching card game everyone loves but with the unexpected excitement of a card-shooting smackdown! When the lightning sounds and the UNO Showdown unit signal goes off, be the first to push down on the paddle. The quickest player wins the showdown and sends cards flying out of the UNO Showdown unit at their opponents! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching them to the card shown on top of the deck. When players are down to one card, they must remember to yell "UNO!" Fun for kid, family or adult game night and a great gift for players ages 7 years and older.

—description from the publisher

Name: Richtig oder falsch?: Quiz
Description:
Quiz game with tricky questions and answers. E.g. "Are there more camels in China than in Egypt? The guessing person has to decide if it is right or wrong and then you read out the interesting answer. The person who gets the most 'right' wins.

—user summary

Name: Rekorde Raten
Description:
A trivia game with 80 questions about curious records. A game leader reads out the questions and the other players answer simultaneously. Whoever is correct receives one of the 30 score cards. After 30 point cards have been distributed, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Necromunda: House of Faith
Description:
From the outside, other Necromundans see House Cawdor as bonepickers, scavengers and beggars, little better than hive rats. But House Cawdor has faith, a faith so strong that it has been saved from extinction where so many other Clan Houses have succumbed to the march of time or other disasters.

Get the ultimate guide to House Cawdor. This 136-page hardback book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the eight different types of fighters available to House Cawdor – Word-Keepers, Priests, Firebrands, Deacons, Cawdor Brethren, Redemptionist Brethren, Bonepickers, and Zealots. It's ideal for fans of House Cawdor or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book you will find:


     House Cawdor History and Background: An expansive and extensive background on the origins of House Cawdor and how it went on to become the largest clan on Necromunda.
     House Cawdor Gang List: All the rules you need in order to field a Cawdor Gang in games of Necromunda, including rules for using Redemptionists in your gangs or for fielding gangs made entirely of these flaming zealots.
     Hangers-on and Brutes: Rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes for your Gang, including Cawdor-specific ones and for using them in games of Necromunda.
     Hired Guns: Rules for using Bounty Hunters, House Agents, and Hive Scum.
     Strong Alliances: Rules for forming alliances with three organisations that House Cawdor has connections with, including the Corpse Guild, Rogue Factoria, and House Ko'iron – the Noble House that backs the House of Faith.
     Additional Rules: This section includes new and additional rules usable by House Cawdor gangs in games of Necromunda, providing Cawdor players a variety of options, including Skills, Abilities, and gang-specific terrain.
     Weapon Reference Chart: A comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available to House Cawdor and their Allies.
     House Cawdor Gang Tactics: A D66 table of Gang Tactics for use in Scenarios.
     Dramatis Personae: Rules for hiring and using four brand-new Dramatis Personae characters in your games of Necromunda.


—description from the publisher

Name: On the Rocks: Promo Drink Cards
Description: 40 new drink recipes with rainbow ingredient spaces. Each recipe has two wild spaces, which are easier to fulfil, but earns $1 less than usual.

Name: Monopoly: Vikings
Description:
Follow the stories of one of the most famous Nordic heroes, Ragnar Lothbrok, his wife, the shield maid Lagertha and his brother Rollo, along with many other characters.

Enter the mysterious world of the Northmen: war, power and fraternity. You can become one of them in this game!

Choose one of the special characters, collect your favourite characters and kingdoms and build boats and longships. The Odin and Valhalla cards can bring blessings or curse. But be careful! In order not to displease the gods, you will have to make sacrifices.

Are you ready for this adventure.

Name: Titans: The Fallen Titan
Description:
The Fallen are summoned to the battle and the underworld is disturbed. The fallen titan of a past age wakes up from the other side and stands to fight his last battle. He has no obligation to one Nation, but his eternal reason – as for any titan – is to wage war. He will move from army to army, sowing terror in the hearts of his enemies.

The Fallen Titan has the same size scale to the other Titans and the miniature is 6.7 cm tall because of his pose.

Name: Dinosaur Table Battles: More Dinosaurs, Please
Description:
This is an expansion for Dinosaur Table Battles. What happened is that Mary asked for more dinosaurs – she may or may not have said please, and it may or may not have been a request. Regardless, six new dino-combatants are ready to join the fifteen from the base game.

Some of the new dinos are classified as Air Dinos and some as Wet Dinos. Air Dinos ignore blocks – unless those blocks are thrown by other Air Dinos! Likewise, the targeting restrictions of Wet Dinos can be negated by enemy Wet Dinos. Air Dinos and Wet Dinos are also weaker against each other – Air Dinos aren't very strong swimmers, and Wet Dinos are afraid of heights. From the massive Quetzalcoatlus to the cunning Gallimimus, these new dinosaurs can dramatically change the flow of a match.

—description from the publisher

Name: Call of Cthulhu: Terror Paths
Description:
Horrors arise. Your Investigators are the people on the spot. If you can’t stop the Menace now, the city, or even the world, may be doomed. You are the only hope, if you can withstand the terrors and stress of the frights that await you.

Terror Paths is a tabletop cooperative experience for several players. All players take on the role of Investigators, who work together as a team. The game comes with two maps, each with wildly different scenarios. While you can just play a one-off scenario, you can also play the game as a campaign.  Keep an eye out for more Terror Paths maps, scenarios, and campaigns.

All the investigators can move and take actions simultaneously, while they puzzle out arcane mysteries, gain insight, and find the tools they need to stave off the Menace. As the adventure begins, you don’t know how to defeat your opposition or even what that opposition consists of!

After the investigators take their turn, the Menace advances. Threat increases, Doom rises, and terrible events occur. Keep in mind that the game has a time limit–if you delay too much, you are ruined. Draw back the veil and embark upon the Terror Path!

—description from the publisher

Name: ArtMasters: The Game
Description:
Immerse yourself in ArtMASTERS-The Game: A fun, challenging competition between 2 to 4 Players ages 14+ to create famous paintings by famous artists one tile at a time! You don't have to be an artist, or even need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide. With each tile drawn, every Player can be an accomplished artist as a Masterpiece is revealed! It's all in the Tube.

How ArtMASTERS is Played

The Object of the Game is to be the first to complete a Masterwork painting in tiles on your game board, call Frame It! and score. 2 to 4 can play.

You don't have to be an artist, or need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide.

Draw Game tiles from the Tube.
Decide which of three paintings to re-create on your game board Canvas.
Tile-by-tile create a famous artist's Masterpiece.
Be the first to complete a 3x4 inch painting in 12 tiles and call Frame It!  to score.
Only the Player who calls Frame It!  for a completed painting scores for that round.

The Game ends when a Player reaches 500 points.

—description from the publisher

Name: AEON: The Emergence of Life
Description:
It’s round about 4 billion years ago. Earth has just recently cooled off enough to have water on its surface. Impacts of comets and meteorites have almost ceased. The sky is orange and dense with thick clouds, through which a faint Sun barely shines. A vast, greenish, muddy ocean covers almost the entire planet. The little dry land is black volcanic rocks and barren. But deep in the ocean and in a few oases, something is cooking: life is about to emerge.

In AEON, you and your friends represent prebiotic environments where Life might have emerged. Together, you build a network of chemical reactions that transforms simple prebiotic reactants into complex molecules. Eventually, these molecules will allow you to establish the basic mechanisms of life which make the reactions more efficient.
The first player to create all the requirements for the emergence of biological evolution wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – New Vegas Rules Expansion
Description:
Enter the dangerous world of the Mojave wasteland, Fight over its future at the Hoover Dam, and get some R and R on the lush New Vegas Strip – if you can afford the entry fee!

The Mojave wasteland stretches from New California Territory to the contested Hoover Dam, containing all sorts of treasures for the bold and dangers for the unwary. For those who come out on tip there is glory or territory to be gained; the unlucky join the desert sands of feed the geckos.

The risks are high, but the rewards are great, all within sight of the glowing lights of New Vegas!

This essential rules expansion allows you to add the flora, fauna and characters from New Vegas to your games of Wasteland Warfare. The New Vegas Rules Expansion includes cards for playing with new Fallout: Wasteland Warfare sets, as well as rules and scenarios for playing in the Mojave wasteland.

The accompanying 40-page rulebook includes a guide to building and painting your NCR and Legion models, a miniatures gallery, new rules for storyline events, a five mission campaign allowing you to refight the battle for the Hoover Dam (with the faction of your choice) and mini achievements to try to earn in games.

Faction/model type rules included in the set cover the NCR, Caesar’s Legion and the Super Mutant Nightkin as well as key characters and allies for the Survivors.

Includes 81 Poker and 150 Euro mini pop-out cards.

Units profiles and AI cards included in this set cover:

The Courier
The Burned Man
NCR Veteran Ranger
NCR Trooper MP
NCR Trooper
NCR Patrol Ranger
NCR Civilian Ranger
NCR Heavy Trooper
1st Recon Sharpshooter
Chief Hanlon
General Lee Oliver
Lieutenant Gorobets
Hound Master
Legion Mongrel
Vexillarius
Veteran Decanus
Praetorian Guard
Prime Legionary
Recruit Legionary
Centurion
Legion Explorer
Legionary Scout
Lucius
Vulpes Inculta
Legate Lanius
Nightkin
Marcus
Lily
Tabitha
Raul
Ede-E
Rex
Veronica
Arcade Gannon
Boone
Cass
Securitron MKI
Securitron MKII
The set also includes the following narrative and upgrade cards:
6 x Perk
1 x Unpredictable
28 x Items
12 x Explore
12 x Event
30 x Stranger/Danger/Creature
8 x Quest 
53 x Weapon
Requires the Two Player Starter set to play.

Name: Spy Sabotage
Description:
In Spy Sabotage, you enter a secret underground auction where the goal is simple: Outbid your opponents in order to collect the three items you need to complete your mission. However, there will be other spies surrounding you, willing to do whatever it takes to obtain the items needed for their own missions. Place your bids strategically and sabotage your opponents when the moment is right!

Spy Sabotage is a fast-paced strategy game for 2-6 players. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a Mission card that shows them the 3 items they need to collect to win the game. Each player also receives the limited funds they will use to collect those items. Each round of the game, players will silently bid on the items available with the goal of collecting their three items, while preventing their opponents from collecting the items they need. Each player also has one Sabotage they can use each game, which destroys an item as well as any bids placed on the item. The first player to collect all three of their items wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Devenez Chef: Recettes de Grand-mère
Description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a complete menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 3 out of 3 – Grand chef level
Main ingredients: spinach, veal, apple 
Other ingredients: mushrooms, rice, carrots, celery, old-fashioned mustard, crème fraiche, bay leaf and leek

Gameplay

     Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors 
     Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players 
     Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list 
     Gather your material with the supplied material list 
     Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Devenez Chef: Végétal' gourmand
Description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a 100% vegan menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: fennel, button mushrooms, apple  
Other ingredients: passion fruit, lemon, oranges, vegetable milk, ground hazelnuts, chestnuts, mint, vegetable soy cream, cinnamon and flat-leaf parsley

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: Gruyere, hazelnut, chervil   
Other ingredients: old-fashioned mustard, olives, mozzarella di bufala, mascarpone, parmesan, lemon, cherry tomatoes, crab, cumin seeds and smoked trout.

Description:

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: pineapple, lemon, chocolate    
Other ingredients: Breton crepes, lavender honey, strawberries, kiwi, soluble coffee, oranges, bananas, cocoa and brioche.

Description:

Difficulty level: 1 out of 3 – Lil'Chef level 
Main ingredients: tomato, chicken, strawberry  
Other ingredients: Grated parmesan, mascarpone, pasta, Gavottes, bananas, zucchini, old-fashioned mustard, Provence herbs, Cancoillotte and chives.

     Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors

Description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a complete menu (starter, main course, dessert).

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level 
Main ingredients: crab, salmon, raspberries   
Other ingredients: Speculoos, pineapple, Philadelphia fresh cheese, kiwis, pink or yellow grapefruit, lemon, sucrine, avocados, pink radishes and shrimps.

Gameplay

     Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors 
     Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players 
     Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list 
     Gather your material with the supplied material list
